meanings.definition: To calculate the total of something again.
meanings.sent1: I retotaled the grocery bill to make sure it was correct.
meanings.sent2: She retotaled the scores to confirm the winner.
meanings.sent3: The accountant retotaled the expenses and found a mistake.
meanings.sent4: After the error, he retotaled the inventory meticulously.
meanings.sent5: The teacher retotaled the exam grades with precision.

meanings.definition: The act of recalculating a total.
meanings.sent1: The retotaling of the budget revealed a discrepancy.
meanings.sent2: He requested a retotaling of the votes to ensure accuracy.
meanings.sent3: The retotaled amount surprised everyone in the room.
meanings.sent4: The retotaling of the expenses was necessary for the audit.
meanings.sent5: The retotaled figure was crucial for the financial report.
